Key Match Events: Correa had a three-hit game, driving in all four Minnesota runs, including a clutch, go-ahead, two-run single in the 10th inning, but the depleted bullpen ran out of gas, with Ronny Henriquez and Michael Tonkin allowing three runs in a 5-4, walk-off loss to the Guardians.
Pre-Game Insights: Correa (4 RBIs) steps up, but Twins' Wild Card margin tightens to half-game
Post-Match Reflections: Bailey Ober, who struck out a career-high 12 batters in seven innings, said, “We've just got to put it behind us… We have to move on and get ready and play like tomorrow is our last day.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins’ lead over the Tigers for the AL’s final Wild Card berth is now a half-game, thanks to Detroit finishing a sweep of Kansas City on Wednesday night.
Others: Correa extended his hitting streak to 16 games, matching a career-high and the longest by a Twin this season, he had reached base in four of his seven plate appearances since coming off the IL entering Wednesday following his two-month absence for the plantar fasciitis.
